page.title: 04BERWICK LIFEBOAT CREW
page.content: The inshore lifeboat needs a crew of four to six people.They are all volunteers who have other jobs and have to be ready to come as soon as they hear the bang of the maroons. One bang means STAND BY Two bangs mean RESCUE Three bangs mean RESCUE,COASTGUARD NEEDED AS WELL. The men can join the crew as soon as they are eighteen years old and because the conditions are often hard they have to leave when they are forty five.They practice regularly,lauching and rescuing drills.They wear one_piece wetsuits,life jackets with whistles attached and orange helmets called 'Bump caps'rather like jockeys.
